title: Can we talk about Kog'Maw?
body:
Look, I never use the word "broken" to define something, but Kog'Maw is the closest thing I've seen to that in a long time. Unless your team has easy engage and lockdown, any Kog'Maw who isn't braindead can carry once it gets far enough into the game for him to get the requisite items, and God help you if there's a Lulu or something similar on his team.

He's just League of Legends' biggest time bomb, and all of his strength is based around **one ability**, which happens to be one of the least interactive abilities in the game. He builds attack speed, presses W, and goes to town on your team. The counterplay is either end before he reaches that power spike or have the right pieces in place to keep that damned mouth of his shut and hope that you do a better job of murdering him than the other team does protecting him.

But if the Kog'Maw is premade with someone else, like a Lulu, and they both know what they're doing, they can still decimate your team if you're not coordinated enough. Sure, you can itemize against him, with stuff like Thornmail, Randuins, and Frozen Heart, but if he gets ahead that won't be enough to stop him without proper focus and followup.

So can we please look into some changes for the guy?

Kind of agree with this guy actually. 

Don't get me wrong, Jax has good late game scaling. But his power probably peaks in the mid game, when he's finished one or two items. He'll still have a substantial level advantage over the duo laners. He'll also be much tankier, relative to late game. ADC and mid laner probably wont have completed their penetration items yet, so the flat resists on Jax's ult will be much stronger.

He's probably a stronger duelist late game than mid game. But he's definitely a stronger team fighter in the mid game.

Jax doesn't carry through team fighting, he carries through splitpushing.  And given that nobody can 1v1 him late game, literally nobody, he's definitely a splitpushing hypercarry.  And just like Kog, he's team-reliant.  If you peel for Kog, he carries, if you allow Jax to push, he carries.
He hasn't been squashed by AP jax.

I give Kogmaw all the hugs when he dies, hes is but a baby and needs the embrace of another to let him know its "ok he did his best everything will be alright" -- You see if you neglect a child in need, even more so at that age, they can and most likely will have irreversible psychological damage. Yeah, we're on the same page at this point. Kog's looking pretty stat checky right now, just clicking people at some points in the game without much subtlety. Some of that looks like just raw power, some is that some of his kit changes aren't working as intended. We're taking a look at him at the moment, aiming to ship some changes in either 6.19 or 6.20. Not sure exactly what yet though, the Live team's looking at possible directions right now.

Meddler, I've noticed that successful kog players don't even get a point in Q until level 13.  Maybe take power out of his W (range?, AS?,  percentage damage?) and E and put some into his Q.  IIRC, the Q skill on most champs is supposed to be the bread and butter skill.

Making Q an ability worth ranking before you have to is likely to be a significant part of any changes. I think the most likely approach there is that we take power from W specifically, that's not definite though.

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=rhNH0kWb,comment-id=002300000000,timestamp=2016-09-05T02:02:48.472+0000)

How does that stop kog from being the late game instant win once everything is maxed out? Moving power isn't fixing the problem, it's just delaying the inevitable making his power spike come an ability level up later. As long as he can do % HP damage with items at a 4.0 attack speed cap, he can't lose trades or be killed easily unless instantly bursted, but steraks gage exist.

We're not scared of what kog does pre-30 minutes, we're scared from 30 after, forcing him to rank something else when it's just making the same late game outcome isn't a solution.
As above that's only expected to be part of the changes. Depending on what sort of power was removed from W to buff Q it could also be possible to reduce Kog's late game power with such a change too.
So then would he be up for a full VGU sometime in 2017/2018?
No, we have no plans for a full VGU on Kog. There are a lot of other champions that need one more and we believe we can address Kog's issues without major art changes.
